trivia_items.text: Her Chinese surname is 仇, which can be pronounced as chóu or qiú. In this case, it should be qiú because this pronunciation is only used as a surname.
sub_items: Out of universe, her name can be a pun on Dugu Qiubai, a character of the famous wuxia novelist Jin Yong, because his skills allowed him to use sword techniques without a sword.

trivia_items.text: Qiubai has the traits of a sika deer (Cervus nippon), specifically the North China sika deer (Cervus nippon mandarinus), which is noted by the shape of her anthers. A small herd of them could be found in her Elite 2 artwork.
sub_items: Her belt has plum blossoms as ornaments, and she carries a stem of plum blossoms in her chibi form. Similarly, the Chinese name for the Sika deer is called the "plum blossom deer (梅花鹿)."

trivia_items.text: Among all NPC characters, Qiubai is the first character that becomes an Operator right after her debut, specifically, after Where Vernal Winds Will Never Blow.
Similar with Chongyue, her English dialogues have a strong Mandarin accent. It is also worth noting that her English VA, Angel Lin, is an English-speaking Chinese.
Qiubai is the first female 6* Lord Guard who previously only consists of SilverAsh and Thorns. She is also the first 6* Lord Guard operator to be released since Thorns in 2.5 years.

Minako Kotobuki, the Japanese VA for Qiubai, played the role of Tsumugi Kotobuki in K-On!. Before her, the voice actresses for the other four main characters in "K-On!" had already voiced for characters in Arknights (Bagpipe, Kal'tsit, W and Dorothy). As a result, some video creators have used the appearance of these five operators and incorporated them into K-On! to create videos.

While her limited headhunting banner is still ongoing in Global server Qiubai also received a rotational headhunting banner during August 31, 2023 CN server banner rotation making her one of the few operators who received rateups on both CN and Global servers.
